document_data.name: Grint Thorg
document_data.mainbody: '''Grint Thorg''' was an adventurer and a [[fighter]] from the city of [[Baldur's Gate]] who died some years before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.History: Grint Thorg perished sometime before the {{YearlinkName|1492}} while adventuring in the infamous [[Tower of Durlag]] on the [[Sword Coast]]. The fighter's body could not be recovered by the adventuring comrades so instead of Grint, the comrades buried Thorg's {{SI|10'|'"|long=yes}} pole in the [[Lower City Graveyard]], near the cemetery arched gate and the [[Durinbold Mausoleum]]. The gravestone was etched with a single inscription: "Grint Thorg, Fighter, Lost in Durlag's Tower. We couldn't recover your body so we buried your [[ten-foot pole]]." The final resting spot may had been accidentally desecrated, and his body risen as a [[zombie]] by [[Nina Dortmell]], a talented child with a [[gift]], who was trying to resurrect her recently deceased brother.
